intro: Necalistis, commonly known as the ghost flower, is a unique plant belonging to the family Apocynaceae. It is native to the arid regions of South Africa, where it thrives in rocky and sandy soils. The plant is characterized by its striking, pale blue or purple flowers that resemble ghostly apparitions, hence its common name. Necalistis has a succulent stem and fleshy leaves that help it store water, adapting to its harsh environment. It is often cultivated for its ornamental value and is considered a rare and exotic addition to botanical gardens.
